t22.title: The DITA For Publishers Open Toolkit Plugins

t23.title: Installing the Toolkit Plugins
t23.desc: How to install the DITA for Publishers Toolkit plugins to the Open Toolkit.

t24.title: Setting Up The kindlegen Command-Line Utility
t24.desc: The Amazon-supplied kindlegen utility is required in order to produce final-form Kindle books.

t25.title: Generating EPUBs and Kindle Books from DITA Content
t25.desc: The D4P EPUB and Kindle book generation Open Toolkit plugins enable generation of delivery-ready EPUBs and Kindle books from any conforming DITA content.

t26.title: Generating EPUBs From OxygenXML
t26.desc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate EPUBs.

t27.title: Generating Kindle Books From OxygenXML
t27.desc: You can configure a DITA transformation scenario in OxygenXML to generate Kindle books.

t28.title: Using Custom CSS Style Sheets
t28.desc: You can include custom CSS styles sheets in your EPUB just as you can for HTML output generally.
t28.keywords: args.copycss args.css args.csspath args.css args.cssroot args.css args.cssroot args.css args.cssroot args.css epub.copy.system.css

t30.title: Creating Cover Graphics and Covers
t30.desc: Some readers and book libraries, such as iBooks, have special conventions for cover graphics.
t30.keywords: data name topicmeta data epub-cover-graphic covers epub-cover-graphic meta map

t31.title: Creating Arbitrary EPUB OPF Metadata
t31.keywords: data data name name meta value data content meta args.xsl

t32.title: Implementing Overrides for Common Processing
t32.desc: You can use the same args.xsl parameter as for the XHTML transform to specify a custom top-level transform that includes overrides to the base processing.

t33.title: Embedding Fonts in Your EPUB
t33.desc:
You can embed fonts into your EPUB by providing a manifest that lists the font files to
    be embedded.
t33.keywords: obfuscate epub.obfuscate.fonts epub.obfuscate.fonts font-face font-face args.xsl font font font-set title desc obfuscate font font-set font-face font css-filename font-set font css-font-family-name css-rules font-face font-face font-face

t34.title: EPUB and Kindle Transformation Parameters
t34.desc: EPUB-specific parameters for the EPUB transformation type

t35.title: cover.graphic.file Ant parameter
t35.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB.

t36.title: d4p.epubtype Ant parameter
t36.desc: Specifies the type of EPUB to generate: EPUB2, EPUB3, or dual EPUB2/3.

t37.title: d4p.max.nav.depth Ant parameter
t37.desc:
Specifies the maximum depth of the navigation table of
    contents.

t38.title: d4p.max.toc.depth Ant parameter
t38.desc:
Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of
    contents.

t39.title: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks Ant parameter
t39.desc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output)

t40.title: epub.copy.system.css Ant parameter
t40.desc: Indicates whether or not to copy the built-in CSS files to the EPUB.

t41.title: epub.font.manifest Ant parameter
t41.desc: Specifies the URI of the font manifest file that lists fonts to be embedded in the EPUB.

t42.title: epub.fonts.output.dir Ant parameter
t42.desc: Specifies the directory within the EPUB to store embedded fonts.

t43.title: epub.javascript.dir Ant parameter
t43.desc:
Specifies the directory, within the EPUB package, to put any JavaScript file included
    using the epub.javascript.file Ant parameterSpecifies the source location of a JavaScript file to be included in the EPUB package     and referenced from every generated HTML file..

t44.title: epub.javascript.file Ant parameter
t44.desc:
Specifies the source location of a JavaScript file to be included in the EPUB package
    and referenced from every generated HTML file.

t45.title: epub.pubid.uri.stub Ant parameter
t45.desc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata.

t46.title: epub.obfuscate.fonts Ant parameter
t46.desc:
Indicates whether or not to obfuscate fonts that are marked as obfuscated in the font
    manifest used when generating the EPUB.

t47.title: epub.generate.css.font.rules Ant parameter
t47.desc:
Indicates whether or not to generate CSS @font-face rules using the configuration
    details specified a font manifest.

t48.title: epub.temp.dir Ant parameter
t48.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit's temp directory.

t49.title: images.output.dir Ant parameter
t49.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images.

t50.title: kindlegen.executable Ant parameter
t50.desc: Specifies the name, and if necessary, full path of the kindlegen command-line executable

t51.title: title.only.topic.class.spec Ant parameter
t51.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

t52.title: title.only.topic.title.class.spec Ant parameter
t52.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for titles for title-only topics generated from topicheads.

t53.title: topics.output.dir Ant parameter
t53.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.

t54.desc:
Using and extending the DITA for Publishers map-driven processing
    framework

t55.title: Data Collection Processing Phase
t55.desc: Overview of map-driven-processing data collection phase

How to use the collected enumeration data to number things in
    output.

Overview of using the grouped and sorted index entries in the
    collected data to do index generation.

t58.desc:
The map-driven processing generates an Ant script that copies graphics or other
    resources from their source locations to the output location.

t59.desc: Generating old-style HTML using map-driven processing

t60.title: Understanding the HTML2 Transformations
t60.desc: Guidance on how the HTML2 XSLT transformations are organized and how the processing works.

t61.desc: Describes the overall processing flow for the HTML2 transformation

t62.title: Extending and Customizing Enumeration Processing (Numbering)
t62.desc: How to customize and extend the default enumeration processing for topic titles and other numbered things.

t64.title: HTML2 Transformation Parameters
t64.desc: Unique parameters for the HTML2 transformation type

t65.title: html2.file.organization.strategy Ant parameter
t65.desc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files.

t66.title: html2.generate.dynamic.toc Ant parameter
t66.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.

t67.title: html2.generate.frameset Ant parameter
t67.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.

t68.title: html2.generate.static.toc Ant parameter
t68.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output.

t69.title: HTML5 Plugin
t69.desc:
The HTML5 transformation type produces HTML5-based output that integrates newer web
    technologies, such as HTML5, CSS3, responsive layouts.

t70.title: Getting Started With the HTML5 Transformation

t72.title: Downloading HTML5 plugin
t72.desc: The html5 plugin is part of the DITA for Publishers set of plugins.

t73.title: Specific installation notes for developers
t73.desc:
If you want to do development with HTML5 plugin, you will need to
        install the YUI compressor tool.

t74.title: Running the HTML5 Plugin
t74.desc: The HTML5 plugin can run as a regular DITA-OT plugin.

t75.title: Changed Behaviours
t75.desc:
This plugin does not always behaves the same way than others DITA OT
  plugins.

t76.title: License
t76.desc: The DITA for Publishers project is released under the Apache License V2.0

t78.title: Replacing the index.html file
t78.desc:
The HTML5 transformation type does not produce an index.html file by
  default.

t79.title: Multiple columns layout
t79.desc:
The html5plugin can allows you to use the latest CSS multi-columns layout for the browsers that support
        it.

t80.title: CSS grid
t80.desc:
The html5 plugin use the 960 Grid System, which allows technical writters to use the
  attribute outputclass to positions their elements on the grid.

t81.title: Image support
t81.desc: The plugin offers the different options for images.

t82.title: Notes
t82.desc: Notes are output with the aside element except when @importance is set to low or obsolete, which will output a details elements. Details elements should be collapsed by default on new browsers.

t83.title: UI
t83.desc: The plugin allows to interact with jQuery UI to output UI on the content.

t84.title: Accordion
t84.desc: Accordion are alternate navigation used to browse the content more quickly.

t85.title: Cycle
t85.desc: This UI allows to present your image in a slideshow.

t86.title: Developers
t86.desc: General information to customize the plugin and create a new Theme

t87.title: Creating a customization plugin
t87.desc:
The steps required to create a customization plugin does not differ from others
  DITA-OT plugin.

t88.title: Theme Development
t88.desc:
The theme mechanism is a preprocessing and packaging mechanism which works on CSS and
  javascripts.

t90.title: Theme configuration file: principle
t90.desc:
The theme configuration file allows to specify which files you want to concatenate and
  compress into a single file. It also provide the information to the html5 xsl code to generate the
  right link and scripts elements.

t97.title: Generating DITA from Documents (Word-to-DITA Transformation Framework)
t97.desc: The DITA for Publishers Word-to-DITA framework is packaged as an Open Toolkit plugin.

t98.title: Extending the DITA for Publishers Transformations
t98.desc: All the DITA for Publishers transformation plugins can be extended using normal Open Toolkit plugin extension techniques.

t99.title: The DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
t99.desc: The DITA for Publishers project provides a set of map and topic types along with a number of markup domains specifically designed to meet the needs of Publishers and publishing-type documents (books and magazines).
t99.keywords: part chapter article subsection sidebar topic glossentry

t100.title: Understanding the DITA For Publishers Markup Vocabulary
t100.desc: This section provides general concepts and usuage guidance for the DITA for Publishers vocabulary.

t101.title: DITA for Publishers Vocabulary Modules Overview
t101.keywords: d4pSidebarAnchor biblioentry bibliomixed classification data ruby fig data keyword text

t102.title: Publication Component Topic Types
t102.desc: The five topic types article, chapter, part, subsection, and sidebar provide the basic building blocks for all publications when coupled with the standard task and glossary entry types.
t102.keywords: article chapter subsection sidebar part topic glossentry task learningContent topic glossentry task topic d4pCover d4pCover

t103.title: Publication Maps
t103.desc: The publication map and publication metadata domains provide a rich set of topic references and metadata elements for use in maps that can represent almost any existing or possible publication.

t104.title: DITA For Publishers Domains
t104.desc: The D4P vocabulary modules include a number of domains you can use to augment both map and topic types.

t105.title: Publication Map Domains
t105.desc: The publication map domains provide building blocks for maps that represent publications.

t106.title: Topic Domains
t106.desc: The topic domains provide markup commonly needed in publications that would not be needed or wanted in most technical publications.
t106.keywords: data classification classification data name value

t107.title: Classification Domain
t107.desc: The classification domain provides metadata specifically for classifying topics or maps, typically in terms of a specific taxonomy.

t108.title: Enumeration Domains
t108.desc: Provides elements for simply identifying enumerations within content (simple enumeration domain) or for defining automatic enumeration "streams".
t108.keywords: d4pSimpleEnumerator data d4pSimpleEnumerator d4pSimpleEnumerator d4pSimpleEnumerator data d4pSimpleEnumerator

t109.title: Formatting Domain
t109.desc: The formatting domain provides elements for producing specific formatting effects that are either arbitrary (not connected to any particular semantic or structural aspect of the content) or simply required to meet specific publication requirements. These elements should be used only when necessary but when they are necessary they are available.
t109.keywords: art art-ph image art art-ph b-i b-sc d4pSidebarAnchor xref outputclass eqn_block eqn_inline eqn_inline art frac inx_snippet linethrough line-through roman tab eqn_inline eqn_block foreign

t110.title: Publication Content Domain
t110.desc: The publication content domain provides general-purpose content elements that are specific to publications.
t110.keywords: epigram epigraph section-pullquote section-pullquote d4pAttributedQuote d4pQuoteAttribution d4pAssetSource art epigraph epigraph-attribution props

t111.title: Rendition Target Attribute Domain
t111.desc: Provides a props specialization for flagging and filtering based on output type (e.g., PDF, EPUB, etc.).

t112.title: Ruby Domain
t112.desc: Provides markup based on the HTML 5 ruby elements for annotating ideographic characters as is done in Japanese-language documents.

t113.title: Variables Domain
t113.desc:
The variables domain provides markup for declaring and referencing
    variables that are scoped by the map and topic hierarchy.
t113.keywords: data data keyword text ruby d4p-variable-definition d4p-variable-definitions d4p-variable-definition d4p-variable-definitions name d4p-variableref-keyword d4p-variableref-text value d4p-variable-definition value d4p-variable-definitions title d4p-variable-definitions d4p-variable-definitions d4p-variable-definition-fallback d4p-variable-definition-fallback d4p-variableref_keyword d4p-variableref_text keyword text d4p-variableref_keyword d4p-variableref_text keyword text topicmeta topicgroup chunk

t114.title: Verse Domain
t114.desc: The verse domain provides markup for representing poetry, songs, and other line-oriented content organized into stanzas.
t114.keywords: verse verse-line stanza verse lines verse verse-line stanza

t115.title: XML Domain
t115.keywords: xmlelem my-tagname xmlatt my-attname textent my-text-entity parment my-parameter-entity numcharref 2014

t116.title: Integrating D4P Modules Into Document Type Shells
t116.desc: To use the vocabulary modules with your own map and topic types you must update your document type shells to include the DITA for Publishers vocabulary modules.

t117.title: Integrating Attribute Domains
t117.desc: Attribute domains are defined in a single .ent file that defines a single parameter entity with the entity declaration and a single general text entity that provides the domains attribute contribution for the module.

t118.title: DITA For Publishers Vocabulary Reference
t118.desc: This section provides reference entries for each of the DITA for Publishers element types and attributes.

t119.title: Topic Type Specializations
t119.desc:
The topic type specializations provide topic types expected in Publishing
    contexts.

t125.title: d4pCover
t125.keywords: d4pCover d4pCover d4pCover d4pCoverTitle searchtitle navtitle

t139.title: subsection
t139.desc: A titled subsection within a chapter or other topic type.

t143.title: Element and Attribute Domains
t143.desc:
The DITA for Publishers element and attribute domains provide a wide variety of
    elements (and a couple of attributes) that can be mixed into topics and maps of any
    type.

t154.title: art
t154.keywords: art image data image art art art-ph art div art art-ph art

t323.title: Map Type Specializations
t323.desc:
The map type specializations provide a number of different map types for specific
    purposes. The most important is the pubmap map type.

t330.title: The DITA For Publishers Word to DITA and DITA to InDesign Tools
t330.desc: This part documents the Word-to-DITA and DITA-to-InDesign transformation frameworks.

t331.desc: The Word-to-DITA (Word2DITA) transformation framework enables the reliable generation of maps and topics form styled Word documents.

t332.desc: How to set up an Ant task to convert a Word document to DITA using the Open Toolkit

t333.desc: How to use the Word-to-DITA Toolkit Plugin to generate DITA content from Word documents.

t346.title: The DITA-to-InDesign Transformation Framework
t346.desc: The DITA-to-InDesign transformation framework enables the generation of InDesign documents and InCopy articles from DITA maps and topics.

t347.title: Overview of the InDesign and InCopy Products
t347.desc: Adobe InDesign and InCopy are companion products, part of Adobe's Creative Suite set of products. InDesign is a desktop publishing tool widely used in Publishing and where typographic quality and layout sophistication are paramount.

t348.title: Generating InCopy Articles from DITA Topics
t348.desc:
You can directly generate InCopy articles from DITA topics using the
    XSLT transforms in the org.dita4publishers.dita2indesign plugin. You do not
    have to use the Open Toolkit to run the transform.

t349.title: Generating InDesign from DITA Using the Toolkit Plugin
t349.desc: How to use the DITA-to-InDesign Toolkit Plugin to generate inDesign and InCopy documents from DITA content.

t350.title: Configuring the DITA-to-InDesign Transformation
t350.desc: You can generate InCopy articles from single topics or from maps using XSLT.

t351.title: Mapping XML Elements to InDesign Paragraph and Character Styles
t351.desc: You define the mapping of elements to specific character and paragraph styles using simple XSLT templates.
t351.keywords: match class select match priority priority xsl:template foo bar bar bar foo class bar priority bar bar priority

t352.title: Specifying InDesign Grouped Style Names
t352.desc:
InDesign styles may be grouped or ungrouped. Grouped styles require
    a specific syntax.

t353.title: Preparing InDesign Templates for DITA-to-InDesign Use
t353.desc: By taking advantage of InDesign features you can maximize the automation provided by the DITA-to-InDesign framework.
